page.title: 14THE VENTURE CLUB OF SELSEY
page.content: The{Venture Club}is a{transport {service}for the elderly.There are three mini buses which each hold 11 people.One has a lift on the back especially for people in{wheelchairs. The seats are confortable with seat belts.People are picked up from their houses and taken home again.On Tuesdays they go to the{library}and on Fridays they go{shopping}and then to the Venture Club room named after Clifford Rhodes where they can have tea and coffee and a biscuit and wait for the Venture Bus to come.They have a big kitchen.They have a room for jumble and a garage for all 3 buses, it is a tight squash for the buses. There are about 40{volunteer drivers who don't wear a uniform. They raise money for petrol and buses by jumble and boutique sales and when people leave money in their wills.
